p: The presence of the virus in the fecal samples of some patients with COVID-19 indicates that the virus can reach the human gastrointestinal tract. About half of all patients suffer from vomiting, diarrhea, and other gastrointestinal disorders. Acute viral hepatitis has also been found in some of these patients [ 74, 75]. After developing symptoms of fever and cough, physicians connect gastrointestinal disorders with COVID-19.
